Abilities.Name: Agile
Abilities.Description: Add dice when performing acts of coordination and grace. Add to attack rolls.

Abilities.Name: Armored
Abilities.Description: Reduce DX of any attack by 1 down to ½ (or zero, GM’s choice)

Abilities.Name: Art of Invisibility
Abilities.Description: Add when attempting to hide or sneak.

Abilities.Name: Attack
Abilities.Description: Increase DX.

Abilities.Name: Barrier
Abilities.Description: You may roll your Barrier dice instead of a Defense roll to defend against a hit. If the attack hits, you can buy off damage with endurance. You can use an action to prepare barrier and roll double your barrier dice to defend a hit.

Abilities.Name: Beautiful
Abilities.Description: Add when attempting to use your appearance to your advantage.

Abilities.Name: Charismatic
Abilities.Description: Add when attempting to convince, distract, inspire, or charm.

Abilities.Name: Combat Expert
Abilities.Description: Add to attack roll showing off offensive expertise or analyzing opponent.

Abilities.Name: Companion
Abilities.Description: You have companion with Health & Endurance of 20. Has Abilities and Weaknesses equal to your level in companion.

Abilities.Name: Connected
Abilities.Description: You have contacts you can call on depending on level in connected.

Abilities.Name: Cute
Abilities.Description: Add when attempting to get what you want, reduce anger, or charm.

Abilities.Name: Dexterous
Abilities.Description: Roll when attempting fine interactions with your hands.

Abilities.Name: Dimentional Pocket
Abilities.Description: Items common to you and are of a liftable weight can be called from the Pocket. Roll your Dimensional Pocket dice and compare it to the DN. DN2: Not Very Useful (Rubber Ducky). DN4: Theoretically Handy (Dinner Plate). DN6: Appropriate Enough (Wooden Practice Sword). DN8: Just What You Needed (Saber). DN10: More Than You Hoped (Automatic Rifle). DN12: Amazingly Apropos (Rocket Launcher).

Abilities.Name: Endurance Reserve
Abilities.Description: Regained after a time (like 24 hrs). Can’t be used for stamina-related tasks, receiving drama dice, or damage taken in combat.

Abilities.Name: Evasive
Abilities.Description: Add dice when attempting to evade.

Abilities.Name: Famous
Abilities.Description: Thought of fondly by people you’ve never met based on level.

Abilities.Name: Flight
Abilities.Description: Roll when testing abilities in the air.

Abilities.Name: Gear
Abilities.Description: An object that has its own abilities and weaknesses.

Abilities.Name: Healer
Abilities.Description: Roll healer dice to heal that amount. Takes significant concentration. GM determines max healing per person per day.

Abilities.Name: Heightened Sense
Abilities.Description: Add dice when using chosen sense.

Abilities.Name: Illusionist
Abilities.Description: Create an illusion. Roll your illusionist dice and the result becomes the DN for others to beat. You may receive a bonus or penalty depending on the complexity of the illusion.

Abilities.Name: Incorporeal Form
Abilities.Description: You can phase out of the physical world. Increased levels improve your control. You may roll incorporeal form dice instead of a defense roll.

Abilities.Name: Intimidating
Abilities.Description: Add dice when trying to intimidate.

Abilities.Name: Intuitive
Abilities.Description: Roll when trying to rely on personal insight.

Abilities.Name: Inventor
Abilities.Description: When trying to build something, roll your inventor dice and other dice that may apply and compare it to the DN. Special parts or periods of time may be required. Characters may start with an invention of complexity equal to their level in inventor.

Abilities.Name: Invisibility
Abilities.Description: Level 1) Just difficult to notice. 2) Very difficult to notice. 3) Invisible, but others could sense your presence in other ways. 4) Invisible to all senses. 5) You leave no trace unless by choice.

Abilities.Name: Iron Willed
Abilities.Description: Add dice when resisting tests of will.

Abilities.Name: Knowledge
Abilities.Description: Choose a topic your character has knowledge in. Add dice when this knowledge would apply. (Typically costs half a level per level put into knowledge).

Abilities.Name: Life Support
Abilities.Description: Survive in uninhabitable environments based on level.

Abilities.Name: Lucky
Abilities.Description: Start with extra drama dice equal to your level in lucky. You are lucky based on level.

Abilities.Name: Magic Arcane
Abilities.Description: Reproduce any ability for yourself or others using endurance. Abilities equal to or less than your level in Arcane automatically succeed. Otherwise, roll your Arcane magic dice along with appropriate dice and compare to the DN. DN = 2 * level of desired ability + 2. Endurance used to cast a spell cannot be regained until the caster relinquishes the effects.

Abilities.Name: Magic Witchcraft
Abilities.Description: Same as Magic, Arcane but for weaknesses. A curse can be removed three ways: caster relinquishes it, caster’s health and endurance reduce to zero, someone with a witchcraft level of equal or higher to the original caster can dispel it. At the GM’s discretion, items may be required to remove certain curses.

Abilities.Name: Minions
Abilities.Description: At level one, summon two minions. Every additional level, double the amount of minions. Minions each have 10 health and 10 endurance. All minions cannot exceed a net +1 in Abilities/Weaknesses. You can combine two minions into one for a 20 health, 20 endurance, net +2 minion, but no further.

Abilities.Name: Passion
Abilities.Description: Add passion dice to all actions when a passion of your choice is present or you are in a specific emotional state.

Abilities.Name: Perceptive
Abilities.Description: Add dice when attempting to notice things.

Abilities.Name: Performer
Abilities.Description: Roll when performing or entertaining.

Abilities.Name: Pilot
Abilities.Description: Add when attempting to pilot any vehicle. (Use knowledge instead if you wish to be specific).

Abilities.Name: Position of Power
Abilities.Description: You hold power and influence based on level.

Abilities.Name: Psychic
Abilities.Description: You can read, alter minds, or talk telepathically. roll vs targets roll, both sides including iron-willed and/or weak-willed modifiers. Psychic action with a bonus require no action and little concentration. 0 requires an action and decent concentration. Actions with a penalty require undivided attention.

Abilities.Name: Quick
Abilities.Description: Add dice when you can use speed to react.

Abilities.Name: Resistance
Abilities.Description: Resilient to a specific type of power or attack. If an attack, DX is reduced, and can reduce to negative. Other abilities suffer a penalty to their roll.

Abilities.Name: Shape Shifter
Abilities.Description: Shape-shift based on level.

Abilities.Name: Sixth Sense
Abilities.Description: Roll to get a feeling for a person, situation, or unforeseen threats.

Abilities.Name: Smart
Abilities.Description: Roll for anything challenging your IQ

Abilities.Name: Spirit Medium
Abilities.Description: Roll against a spirit’s highest ability level when trying to banish or summon a spirit.

Abilities.Name: Strong
Abilities.Description: Add dice when performing acts of physical strength. Also is a bonus to your DX when striking with power.

Abilities.Name: Telekinesis
Abilities.Description: Roll telekinesis much like the strong ability to move heavy objects. You can add your telekinesis level as a bonus to your DX when performing an attack with telekinesis.

Abilities.Name: Teleport
Abilities.Description: Roll vs DN to teleport. You may roll teleport instead of a defense roll.

Abilities.Name: Time Freeze
Abilities.Description: You can slow or freeze the flow of time. As an action, gain bonus in speed and quickness or enemies gain penalties equal to your level in Time freeze.

Abilities.Name: Tough
Abilities.Description: Gain a bonus to health. Add tough when exhibiting resilience and durability.

Abilities.Name: Transformation
Abilities.Description: For every level in transformation, spend double that in new and improved abilities and weaknesses.

Abilities.Name: Vehicle
Abilities.Description: Use double your vehicle level to build your vehicle with abilities.

Abilities.Name: Vigorous
Abilities.Description: Bonus endurance. Roll to resist ailments, exhaustion, and recover health.

Abilities.Name: Walking Arsenal
Abilities.Description: Choose another ability as a focus, such as gear or vehicle. Choose a theme. If it’s an object of that ability and theme and is of equal or less level than your level in Walking Arsenal, then you have it.

Abilities.Name: Wealthy
Abilities.Description: You have money based on level.
